text: Keith Grayson (August 14, 1966 â€“ April 17, 2022), professionally known as DJ Kay Slay, was an American disc jockey. He is referred to by The New York Times as "Hip Hop's One-Man Ministry of Insults". Grayson was born on August 14, 1966, in the New York City neighborhood of Bronx. He began his career in the 1980's. On April 17, 2022, Grayson died from COVID-19 at age 55. ==Studio albums== DJ Kay Slay has released six studio albums: Year Album 2003 The Streetsweeper, Vol. 1 2004 The Streetsweeper, Vol. 2 2010 More Than Just a DJ 2017 The Big Brother 2019 Hip Hop Frontline 2021 The Soul Controller == References == Category:1966 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American DJs Category:Musicians from the Bronx Category:African-American musicians Category:American prisoners Category:American record producers Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in New York City Category:Pseudonyms
title: DJ Kay Slay
